brewery.brewery_description:
Ringwood Brewery was founded by Peter Austin in 1978, a man who is revered as "the father of British Micro-brewing".

Ringwood Brewery's first brewhouse was in a former bakery in the old station yard brewing Best Bitter and Fortyniner for a handful of local customers. 1979 saw the production of Old Thumper, which has since become the flagship brew.

In 1986, having outgrown the Minty's yard premises, the brewery moved to its present site, ironically the location of the old Tunks' Brewery which ceased trading
in 1821.

Today the brewery is able to produce circa 40,000 barrels of its renowned and distinctive beers. In addition to Best, Fortyniner, and Old Thumper, we now brew the blonde Boondoggle and the deliciously warming XXXX Porter.

beer.beer_description:
ABV 3.8% (cask); 3.6% (bottle) 

The perfect supping beer. Our first brew and still a favourite tipple. Tempting hop aroma with fruit notes. Good malt feel in the mouth dry, tangy fruit finish. Delicious, easy drinking slightly tart pale bitter. Razorback is brewed to the same recipe as the famous Ringwood Best Bitter, which has been revered for its quality since 1978. 

With an ideal balance of hoppy happiness and citrus fruit, our classic Razorback is plenty refreshing to hit the spot. An easy drinking thirst quenching bitter that’s perfect for all occasions.

items.checkin_comment: pretty good the old boon doggie, definitely didn’t fall asleep watching tv again. nice and hoppy and pretty sweet

beer.beer_description:
Boondoggle is an American term first coined in the 1920’s. Boondoggle is a word meaning 'work of little value' which we have interpreted to mean 'Jolly' or ‘any excuse for a pint’.
Nose:
A hoppy aroma with a citrus punch.
Palate:
A well balanced moreish fruity taste.
Comments:
A blonde and luscious ale – the perfect excuse. Brewed with the finest English Pale Malt, Goldings, Herkules, Cascade and Styrian Bobek hops.

items.badge_description: While a pint of traditional English ale will always remain a staple, the craft beer scene in England, much like the rest of the world, has continued to grow at a rapid rate! That's 315 different beers from a brewery from England! Try 5 more for Level 64!

Fortyniner is named after the 1849 gold rush. Golden in colour and brewed to 4.9%, Ringwood has been brewing this classic beer since 1978.

Draft 5.6% ABV - Bottle 5.1% ABV.

Ringwood's most iconic beer was first brewed in late 1979 without a name. A competition in the local press inspired Joe Leedham from Broadstone, Dorset to come up with a suitable suggestion!

Nose:
Peppery, spicy aroma with a hint of apples.
Palate:
Luscious balance of grain and hop in the mouth. Bitter sweet finish with delicate fruit notes.

Comments:
Warm, rounded yet surprisingly delicate pale strong beer.
Hoppy and full flavoured

The perfect balance; a golden craft beer delivering crisp bitterness, combined with a thirst quenching refreshing finish. Best enjoyed with a rack of ribs.
“”

Smooth, laid back ruby beer perfect for the festive season. Rich, smoky, aromas of roasted malt; a real winter warmer.
“..Available November.
A pronounced bitterness, complemented by subtle roasted malt undertones make this a well-rounded quaffable beer. Best enjoyed with a rack of ribs. September availability.

Beer from the heart of the forest.Brewed in the heart of the New Forest, Best Bitter is a rich brown well-rounded beer with a malty, toffee flavour balanced by a tangy citrus hoppiness. It is brewed with floor-malted Maris Otter along with delicious chocolate malts in a traditional mash tun. Goldings, Progress, Fuggles and Challenger hops give a balanced aroma and flavour tothe beer
A luscious New England IPA packed with juicy blueberry and tropical fruit flavours.
Almost caramel character with some earthy notes. Fruity, light caramel and some berry bitterness at the finish.

An all-time favourite and back by popular demand, this glorious amber ale with a smooth malty finish delivers true glory 
Best enjoyed seated whilst munching on a hog roast.
Rich brown, easy drinking craft bitter, packing a full bodied malty taste and fruity, hoppy aroma.

This is an American wheat beer with an inviting light golden colour and crisp malt flavour.

A lively brew, it’s a clean, cool and refreshing light-bodied ale, worthy of a relaxing afternoon in the sun. This brew is an ode to summer in Maine. In the States, many people serve this beer with a lime wedge.

Summer Ale was first brewed in Maine in June 1995. It uses British pale ale and Munich malt and wheat, combined with a top-fermenting yeast and Saphir and Willamette hops.

A well rounded strong golden ale with fruity undertones. Exquisitely crafted by the experts in relaxation. Best enjoyed with suckling pig
“ - February seasonal.
Originally brewed in 2008 to celebrate the 30th anniversary of Ringwood Brewery, March 1978. This made a return in 2018 for a limited supply to celebrate the 40th anniversary.
Rich, malty, bitter and hoppy.

An amber ale crafted by the experts in relaxation..
Kick back and enjoy the glow of this warming ale with a rich, malt finish.
Contract brewed by Marston's PLC for the UK market.
A beer for the pack to hunt down! Brewed to 4.0% abv this quaffable beer is copper in colour, with a full malty taste. The traditional hoppy aroma is infused with toffee overtones. Scrumptious!
